meanings.definition: The condition of having separate carpels in a flower.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the botanist pointed out the apocarpy of the lily.
meanings.sent2: The apocarpy of the daisy allows for cross-pollination.
meanings.sent3: The apocarpy of the rose made it difficult for the bees to gather nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like the apocarpy of a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent5: The apocarpy of the tulip stood out among the other flowers.

meanings.definition: The state of having distinct fruiting bodies.
meanings.sent1: The forest was full of trees showing apocarpy in their fruits.
meanings.sent2: The apocarpy of the apple tree made it easy to distinguish from the pear tree.
meanings.sent3: The apocarpy of the orange tree made it look like a fruit orchestra.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like the apocarpy of different fruits, each unique and valuable.
meanings.sent5: The apocarpy of the cherry tree was a sight to behold in the orchard.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having unjoined ovaries.
meanings.sent1: The biologist studied the apocarpy of the plant under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The apocarpy of the strawberry plant fascinated the students in biology class.
meanings.sent3: The apocarpy of the tomato plant made it a challenge for pollination.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the apocarpy of the plant's ovaries.
meanings.sent5: The apocarpy of the pumpkin plant ensured each fruit grew independently.
